developerResponse: {'id': 34845754, 'body': 'Thank you so much for taking the time to write this review, we appreciate it very much!', 'modified': '2023-02-13T19:46:50Z'}
content: This app is absolutely amazing. The only language I had a basic grasp going in was python, but I started taking the web-development courses(currently 20% to certification) and have been able to fly through at my own pace. Mimo encourages learning through a healthy sense of challenge/competition but keeps it from becoming demanding. It challenges you just enough to keep you interested. Best part is the app is free, enacting a ‚Äúlives system‚Äù like your typical phone game would. The lives(5 to be exact) are pretty much enough to get you through one day assuming you don‚Äôt go premium. Once you run out it‚Äôs roughly three hours for one heart, essentially encouraging coming back daily to learn. It also has a simple daily streak mechanic that further encourages daily involvement and the previously mentioned competition is a leaderboard that slightly encourages trying harder when learning. This has been the best experience I have ever had in my journey to learn how to program. Between the textbooks and other online courses, this is hands down my favorite experience.
title: ‚Ä¶ And it‚Äôs all free

developerResponse: {'id': 35479181, 'body': "Thank you so much for your delightful review, we really appreciate it! If there's something we can do to deliver a 5-star experience for you, please let us know (feedback@getmimo.com). In the meantime, all the best!", 'modified': '2023-03-20T10:16:59Z'}
content:
Mimo is exquisite. I‚Äôm learning python at a rapid pace, like a rabbit, bounding past a turt and saying ‚ÄúOh you simple one. Oh you one without wisdom. I have seen the light; I have been enlightened.‚Äù All that Mimo gives so freely couldn‚Äôt have been conceived in my wildest visions. Mimo... is like  heaven come to earth. It‚Äôs sleek design, a satisfying ui and, dare I say, Mimolicios leaderboard has inspired me each and every day to expand my brain capacity.  The Mimo experience; a hill with flowers atop, a place to call home, a place to call school. I have climbed passed my ‚Äúpeers‚Äù, with my intellectual prowess, easily shooting to the top of every leaderboard in my sight. I feel like a child, touching the face of God as my eyes are opened. This is what it all means. I feel like the summarians, national  superpowers that saw what the human capacity currently was, and didn‚Äôt except it: no, they rebelled against there primitive form and invented the basis for the advances we are able to make today. As I sit here, wrighting this reflection of the greatest peece of the puzzle that is our human experience: I reflect apon my life before Mimo, the melancholy state I was in. I don‚Äôt shame those who are experiencing a similar way of living; no, I call them, I offer them a hand  out of the dusty, well trodden rode they are crouched on, and say: ‚Äúlet me offer you something greater, something inspiring and powerful: let me grant you Mimo.‚Äù

4/5 cuz of some bugs
title: Mimo: a comprehensive study

title: Earned coins & percent progress bar disappeared after latest update

content: I literally downloaded this last night on a complete whim, and it‚Äôs so addicting that I‚Äôm already 20% through the python course. They break everything down in a way that‚Äôs extremely easy to learn even for complete beginners like myself, and gradually up the challenge the more you progress through your lessons. There‚Äôs also mini projects that come with each lesson to help you apply what you‚Äôre learning in a practical way. The pro subscription is more than reasonable for all of the material you learn, and lets you do as many modules as you want. I already recommended this app to everyone I could, and I‚Äôm so excited to keep learning more!
title: Fantastic app for beginners!

content:
I cannot stress the comparison enough, the two are nearly identical. I was afraid that they wouldn‚Äôt have much content, but was shocked to see that they have python, SQL, HTML, and JS. The UI feels like your working directly on your computer‚Äôs command prompt, and the instructions are very simple to follow. 

Almost too simple, and my only complaint would be to add a textbook style lesson plan that goes into big picture concepts for what you‚Äôre learning as you get through each lesson. Being a beginner, I‚Äôd like to learn how expansive each concept could be used for, but understand how it starts small as to not scare too many people away. 

TL;DR This is a fantastic way to jump into coding.
title: Duolingo for Coding Languages

content: I love this app and it‚Äôs actually kind of addicting even though I spend a lot of time gaming. It‚Äôs very educational and I would recommend it if you really love coding. All of it is amazing except the hearts. You have 5 lives and if you get a question wrong, you get a life taken away. It‚Äôs kind of disappointing that you have lives when you really want to learn how coding/python works. If you run out of lives, you can buy lives with the in-game currency or wait. But everything else is amazing! Again, I would recommend it.
title: It‚Äôs amazing but‚Ä¶

content: This app is a great start for anyone looking to learn the basics of web development, python , or SQL. The competition factor gives you motivation to keep your rank high. I think it‚Äôs perfect to learn the basics but that‚Äôs about it. I give it 4 stars but if the lessons were longer and more in depth I‚Äôd give it 5 . Also I feel that the lessons are too short which you could easily finish before one month. I also think that some lessons teach you a brand new method or object and not enough reinforcement of previously learned material as it isn‚Äôt gradually added onto the lessons only slightly.
title: A Great start

content: This is definitely a great beginner coding app. I‚Äôve been learning python through it and it‚Äôs going well. However, I do think that they need to increase the difficulty as you get further into the curriculum. When you start understanding the basics and more, it becomes way too easy when all you have to do is ‚Äútap‚Äù the answer at the bottom of the page, or simply put in the answer they give you in the question/statement. I think it would be better if they made us use our thinking and problem solving skills a little more.
title: Great App for Beginners! However‚Ä¶

content: This is like the 3rd program I‚Äôve used to learn python . udacity and kaggle are great but some they‚Äôre lessons maybe a bit intimidating if you have 0 background with python.(my case) this app relays the information as if you where a baby. Honestly it may feel easy but it‚Äôs so repetitive that it sticks!!! Try the 14 day trial if you‚Äôre really trying to learn this try to find a buddy to practice text messaging via python language it‚Äôs kinda funny and helps. Really excited to continue!
title: Please try the 14 day trial!!!!

title: Great app

content: This app uses small, digestible chunks presented in memorable ways in a clean and effective UI. It makes the matter (in my case, Python) approachable and easy: it feels like Duolingo for computers. Content is good, as far as I can tell (I'm using this to review/sneak in more python lessons when I can't knock out a full chapter of a more academic course). I'm really pleased with it. Lessons are short and concluded with a quiz and some PEs. The introductory lessons won't be particularly satisfying, which seems to be their business model: here's a sample chapter of stuff we can teach you and how we teach. I also want to contribute to the matter of paying for an app: you get what you pay for. In this case, they give you a very brief introduction to any of the subjects they cover, without ads. I'd much rather have a clean learning environment that I paid for rather than having to sit through a 30 second MMORTS ad every few lessons.
title: Really effective and ambitious.

Keep your eyes on Mimo and have a great day! Cheers! Your Mimo Team', 'modified': '2018-08-07T09:00:33Z'}
content:
Spending $30 for the whole year definitely isn‚Äôt horrible, but after starting to go through these courses (as they definitely are very interesting and helpful) I‚Äôm starting to realize a lot of these courses end a bit early and could definitely go into more detail. I hope that over the course of the year they‚Äôll expand upon the courses already offered or make some new topics for people to explore.

Other than that, it‚Äôs a really great app for kids and teens to start getting into git, python, and a variety of other languages.
